accessibility-information-preserved-part: In the testing we have done, yes.
auto-content-accessible-partially-descri: There are limits. Efforts to incorporate ideas from We4Authors study. Integration of accessibility checking for authors isn't yet part of Drupal Core, but there are contributed modules to help with this.
comments: Some elements of ATAG are much harder to implement given the flexibility of authoring tools.
tool-description: @@500 -- Drupal is an open-source content management system (CMS) that is used to create and manage websites. It is written in the PHP programming language and uses a database to store its content. Drupal is known for its flexibility and modular design, which allows users to easily create and customize their websites to meet their specific needs. It is used by organizations of all sizes, including governments, businesses, and non-profits, to create a wide range of websites, from simple blogs to complex e-commerce platforms. Drupal is maintained and developed by a global community of volunteers and is released under the GNU General Public License.
web-based-accessible-partially-descripti: Since Drupal 7 we have worked to see the admin interface is as accessible as the public facing interface. This is something that is a work in progress as the software evolves. Accessibility is a priority for our community, but there are is always work to do.
